required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Iron-fortified Pea Powder on Exercise Performance
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Low-phytate Pea Powder With High Iron Bioavailability on Iron Status of Female Runners

brief_summary.textblock: Female endurance athletes are susceptible to iron deficiency and this can impact their exercise performance. This study assesses the impact of an pea protein supplement with high iron bio-availability on iron status and exercise performance.

detailed_description.textblock: Female endurance athletes are susceptible to iron deficiency due to poor iron intake from diets or possibly because of destruction of red blood cells during foot-strike hemolysis. This study will evaluate the impact of 8-weeks of iron supplementation through consumption of a pea-protein power that has high iron bio-availability due to low phytate levels. This will be compared to consumption of regular iron protein powder and maltodextrin placebo by randomizing participants to three groups. Participants will be assessed at baseline and after 8 weeks of supplementation for exercise performance (maximal aerobic capacity and a 5 km time trial running test), blood levels of ferritin and hemoglobin, and body composition (fat mass and lean tissue mass).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are being randomized to three groups for the 8-week intervention: Pea power with high iron bio-availability Regular pea powder Placebo (maltodextrin)
study_design_info.masking_description: The powder supplements are being administered in a blinded manner. An individual who is separate from the rest of the research team will generate the allocation schedule and prepare the supplement packages so that participants, investigators, and outcome assessors are blinded. Statistical analysis will be blinded by coding of groups

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in ferritin levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in maximal aerobic capacity
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal aerobic capacity (mL/kg/min) measured on a treadmill

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in exercise time trial performance
secondary_outcome.description: Time (minutes) to complete 5 km running on a treadmill

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in hemoglobin levels
Change from baseline in lean tissue mass
secondary_outcome.description: Lean tissue mass (kg) measured with dual energy X-ray absorptiometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fat mass
secondary_outcome.description: Fat mass (kg) measured with dual energy X-ray absorptiometry

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pea power with high iron bio-availability
arm_group.description: Pea powder with low phytate levels to increase iron bio-availability (7mg iron per day)
Pea powder with normal phytate levels (7mg iron per day)

intervention.description: Exercise performance with low phytate pea powder
intervention.arm_group_label: Pea power with high iron bio-availability

intervention.description: Exercise performance with regular pea powder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Regularly participate in aerobic endurance training
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contra-indications to exercise testing as determined with the "Get Active Questionnaire"
